id2: CLAYSTONE : Light grey to medium grey, occasionally olive grey to brownish grey. Moderately to slightly calcareous, trace carbonaceous specks, soft, slightly dispersive, sub-blocky, grading to Siltstone.

id3: SILTSTONE : Olive grey to light brownish grey, occasionally medium grey. Slight to moderately calcareous cement, trace pyrite aggregates, trace micro-mica, trace carbonaceous specks, trace dolomite, soft to firm, sub-blocky to blocky.

id4: There were no oil shows in this interval.

id5: 3896 m to 4229m: CLAYSTONE with minor SILTSTONE and trace Sandstone

id6: CLAYSTONE 1: Medium dark grey to dark grey, grey black. Non calcareous, trace Inoceramus, trace nodular pyrite and common locally disseminated pyrite, commonly micro-micaceous, firm to moderately hard, sub-blocky, brittle in parts.

id7: CLAYSTONE 2: Light grey to olive grey, occasionally medium dark grey. Slightly to moderately calcareous, abundant olive grey and medium grey calcite and dolomite infilled spherical Radiolaria in parts, trace carbonaceous specks, very soft to soft, dispersive in parts, sub-blocky in parts, grading to Siltstone in parts.

id8: SILTSTONE : Medium grey, light olive grey to light brownish grey. Slight to moderate calcareous cement, argillaceous matrix, common calcareous infilled Radiolaria, trace glauconite, trace pyrite aggregates, commonly micro-micaceous, trace carbonaceous specks, trace dolomite, soft to firm, sub-blocky.

id9: SANDSTONE : Very thin laminae. Brown stained and occasional clear to translucent. Very fine to fine grained, moderately sorted, sub-angular to sub-rounded, abundant calcareous and dolomitic cement, abundant dark and grey brown argillaceous matrix, soft to friable, poor visible porosity, no shows.

id10: There were no oil shows in this interval.

id11: 4229 m to 4439m: CLAYSTONE interbedded with SILTSTONE and minor layer of SANDSTONE

id12: CLAYSTONE : Medium dark grey to dark grey, olive grey to brownish grey, occasionally brownish black. Non to very slightly calcareous, trace pyrite nodules, trace carbonaceous specks, commonly micro- micaceous, commonly soft to firm, occasionally moderately hard, sub-blocky to blocky, occasionally sub- fissile, commonly grading to Siltstone.

id13: SILTSTONE : Medium light grey to medium grey, light olive grey to brownish grey. Slightly calcareous cement, commonly argillaceous matrix, abundant micro-mica, trace disseminated glauconite, trace pyrite nodules, trace carbonaceous specks, soft to firm, sub-blocky to blocky, locally grading to very fine grained Sandstone.

id14: SANDSTONE : Light grey to grey or brown. Very fine grained, well sorted, sub-angular to sub-rounded, moderately calcareous cement, moderately dolomitic cement, abundant silty argillaceous matrix, trace dark lithic fragments, non to trace visual porosity.

id15: There were no oil shows in this interval.

id16: 4439 m to 4632m: SILTSTONE interbedded with CLAYSTONE, thin layer of LIMESTONE and minor SANDSTONE

id17: CLAYSTONE : Medium dark grey to dark grey, occasionally brownish grey. Non to slightly calcareous, abundant quartz silt, trace carbonaceous specks, trace to commonly micro-micaceous, trace disseminated glauconite, trace pyrite nodules, micro lenses of calcite, soft to firm, sub-blocky in shape, locally grading to Siltstone.

id18: SILTSTONE : Medium dark grey to dark grey, olive grey to brownish grey. Non to slightly calcareous,

id19: common argillaceous matrix, common micro-mica, trace glauconite, trace carbonaceous specks, soft to moderately hard, brittle in-part, sub-blocky to blocky, occasionally grading to very fine Sandstone.
